text: Small bay below center is the northern tip of the protected section of the "Van Hook Arm" Van Hook State Wildlife Management Area is a Wildlife Management Area on the Van Hook Arm of Lake Sakakawea in Mountrail County, North Dakota. The Van Hook Arm of Lake Sakakawea is managed by a different county than the Garrison Dam which formed it. The closest town to the WMA is New Town, North Dakota and the Soo Line Railroad runs through it on its way to Parshall, North Dakota.Map Sheet on North Dakota Game and Fish Department website ==References== *Wildlife Management Area directory listing Category:National Wildlife Refuges in North Dakota Category:Protected areas of Mountrail County, North Dakota
title: Van Hook State Wildlife Management Area
